text: e Euclidean and Manhattan distances are special cases of Minkowski distance: 1 m P Minkowski(a,b) = (Z abs(ali] — b[i])p) i=1 * Different values of parameter p result in different distance measures ¢ Manhattan distance forp=1 ¢ Euclidean distance forp =2 * The larger the value of p the more emphasis is placed on features with large differences in values because these differences are raised to the power pT I < DuBLIN
